title: Ordinary Social Occasions, Sandcastles and Structural Reproduction
features: Using a newly developed hybrid method of interviewing recent ingenuous participants in ordinary occasions to derive detailed descriptions of what they had authentically observed to have been said and done, Boughey develops categories of participant-defined activity modes of identifications.
description: Howard Nathaniel Boughey is Associate Professor of Sociology at the University of Toronto, Canada.
